byline.contributor: Jack Ewing reported from Haltern am See, and Melissa Eddy from Berlin. Raphael Minder contributed reporting from Barcelona, Spain.
byline.original: By JACK EWING and MELISSA EDDY

abstract: Sixteen students from small town outside Dusseldorf, Germany, were on board Germanwings jet that crashed in French Alps; students had spent week in small town outside Barcelona, Spain, as part of an annual exchange program.
lead_paragraph: This time of year, thousands of students, like the ones on the Germanwings flight that crashed Tuesday, board planes for a week or two of foreign culture, a highlight of their school year.

headline.main: In German Town, a School-Year Highlight That Ended in Disaster
headline.print_headline: For Students From Germany, a School-Year Highlight That Ended in Disaster

snippet: This time of year, thousands of students, like the ones on the Germanwings flight that crashed Tuesday, board planes for a week or two of foreign culture, a highlight of their school year.
